alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. Portions of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms slowly moving southeast. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with additional rain moving into the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gonzalez, Pace, Milton, Goulding, Bagdad, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Perdido Beach, Floridatown, Pea Ridge, Pine Forest, Olive, Bellview and Avondale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
